subject: Re: [junit] Junit problem
msgSnippet: Why not just use NUnit? Its designed for .NET from the ground up and understands class loading in .NET? We used quite successfully while we had a .NET product.
messageBody:
Why not just use NUnit? Its designed for .NET from the ground up and
understands class loading in .NET? We used quite successfully while we had a
.NET product.

Mark
